channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Balloon canisters litter, 28th September
item.description:
There are balloon canisters that outsiders have littered in the area, these people seem to not live in the area but use it as an area to chuck it away. In carronade place, temple close the walk way between 20 carronade place and houses connecting to 40 carronade place. In the bushes, outsiders have chucked it. Please could you place cameras as it is a reoccurring problem- to catch who is doing this, and reinstall the bin that has been removed and take away the canisters and any litter nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Temple Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden waste dumped on pavement, 28th September
item.description:
A significant amount of garden waste has been dumped on the pavement outside No9 Shenley Road, coincidentally immediately after the front hedge of No9 was trimmed. It has been abandoned for over a week and no collection arranged, and is now blocking the pavement for pedestrians with mobility challenges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Shenley Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 by the 401/469 Bus Stop, 28th September
item.description:
A large quantity of rubbish in black plastic sacks has been dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road. There is also a number of black plastic sacks filled with rubbish dumped by the Virgin Media Green Cabinet on the pavement at the junction with Halt Robin Road and Picardy Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove all of the rubbish as soon as practical

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Building rubbish dumped at the bottom of steps, 28th September
item.description:
Building rubbish dumped at the bottom of steps leading down from Arbuthnot lane to basing drive. Also barriers are still there from closing the steps they have been closed off for at least 6 weeks now no work has been done. TFL told me it still in planning stage. They been closing steps off for at least three years now still no works been carried out . Can you look at the status of the work and find out when itâ€™s being done please. Barriers have been pulled down and chucked everywhere
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arbuthnot Lane, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial Way pavement illegally blocked?, 28th September
item.description:
44 Peckham Hill Street has been undergoing refurbishment for the past year. About a week ago, a scaffolding compound was erected occupying the entire width of Commercial way pavement to the side of the property meaning pedestrians have to step out into traffic on Commercial Way to circumnavigate it, but it also blocks visibility creating a significant hazard. You now can't safely cross Commercial Way without backtracking all the way to Sumner Road because it blocks access to the crossing. In addition, at an earlier stage of works, heavy lorries would often be parked on the pavement at the rear of the property on Bonar Road removing rubble, completely blocking the drop kerb and tactile paving. In doing so, the paving slabs on the corner of Bonar Road / Commercial Way have been badly cracked. Conveniently Google Street view from October 2024 catches a lorry in the act.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Peckham Hill Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
